intro: Begonia catharinensis, commonly known as the São Paulo begonia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that often display intricate patterns and vibrant colors. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
